Header: Japan’s new imperial era to be named “Reiwa”
Content: Japan’s new imperial era to begin on May 1, when Crown Prince Naruhito becomes emperor, will be called “Reiwa”, Chief Cabinet Secretary Yoshihide Suga announced today, a month ahead of Emperor Akihito’s abdication. The era name, or “gengo,” is used widely in Japan on coins, calendars, newspapers and in official paperwork. Following the announcement, Japanese Prime Minister Shinzo Abe said the government approved “Reiwa”, the characters from the Manyoshu an ancient collection of Japanese poetry as the best gengo to show hopes for the new era. There have been four era names in Japan’s modern history: Meiji, Taisho, Showa and the current Heisei, meaning “achieving peace.”
